content:
Although it is not possible to provide proof for the following claim, can you formally prove that proof cannot be provided?

variable (P Q R : Prop)

example (hP : P) : Q

If it could be, then since these are variables we can produce a proof of false (by naming your example foo) with foo True False trivial. It has already been demonstrated that Lean does not have a proof of false, so this concludes the proof.
You can prove \not \forall (P Q R : Prop), P â†’ Q
thank you very much for many advices! I understood!
Naoto_ONDA has marked this topic as resolved.
